messages.title: 60 SECOND Q&A
messages.content: Answers to various questions on why voting is important, local problems, restoring trust in politicians, and reasons to vote for Alan Duncan.

issues.economy: After 13 years of Labour's financial mismanagement, the economy is not in great shape. This has damaged vital services and local businesses.
issues.governance: Restoring trust in politicians is crucial, constituents must know that their MP is working to their best interests.
issues.health: A personal commitment to the NHS, increasing spending and improving service for everyone.

housing.content: Helping with housing or a local business in trouble; have always been there to help.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have campaigned for the constituency, defended local issues, and have the experience in dealing with all levels of government to secure a better deal for constituents.

politicalExperience.achievements: Successfully campaigned against the previous government's proposals to turn Melton Mowbray into a 'Titan Jail' town.

contactInformation.address: 136 High Street, Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire, LE13 0TR

quotes.text: The choice at this election is clear: five more years of Gordon Brown's tired government making things worse or change with the Conservatives.

images.caption: Photos of Alan Duncan in various community settings.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Includes a personal message from David Cameron outlining why change in Britain is needed today.
